body_content.explanation: to move or travel around an area, especially a large one:
examples: Some vets spend their time roving around in a truck tending to horses and cattle.
And now a live report from our roving reporter, Martin Jackson.
He spent most of his life roving the world in search of his fortune.

body_content.explanation: If someone's hands or eyes rove, they touch or look in many different places, especially in a sexual way or when they should not do this:
examples: She let her hands rove over his smooth hard muscles.
By his own admission he had a roving eye and was easily infatuated.
He was mostly quiet along the way, eyes roving the shore.
